title: A dinosaur bigger than T. rex swam and hunted its prey underwater
description: It's long been thought that dinosaurs were land lubbers -- terrestrial creatures that steered largely clear of water.

title: Miley Cyrus' plane forced to make emergency landing after being struck by lightning
description: Miley Cyrus was on her way to Paraguay when her flight had to make an emergency landing.

title: Madeleine Albright predicted Putin's strategic disaster in Ukraine
Tiger attack at Florida Everglades attraction injures employee
description: A tiger attacked an employee of a Florida Everglades tourist attraction Tuesday, leaving him hospitalized with severe injuries, officials said.

title: Dug, 'the world's largest potato,' revealed to not be a potato
description: Dug may not be the world's largest potato, but it's still pretty spudtacular.

title: Late night hosts mock Supreme Court confirmation hearings
description: Late night hosts poke fun at GOP's line of questioning during the Supreme Court nomination hearings for Ketanji Brown Jackson.

title: A pizza dough without yeast has been risen by scientists in Italy
description: The star ingredient responsible for an airy, bubbly pizza crust is yeast. As cells that eat sugar and convert into carbon dioxide, yeast is what makes dough rise -- yet Italian scientists have discovered a way to make pizza dough without it.

title: 'Reduced to ashes': Stunning footage shows what's left of Ukrainian city
description: The besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol has been under nearly constant Russian bombardment from long-range missiles and artillery since early March.

title: Fight Alzheimer's in your mid-30s by tracking these warning signs
description: Having high cholesterol and blood sugar in your 30s may raise your risk for Alzheimer's disease decades later in life, according to a new study.

title: Mackenzie Scott has given $3.8 billion to 465 organizations since June
description: Mackenzie Scott said Wednesday she has donated more than $3.8 billion to 465 organizations since June.

title: T. rex skeleton, the world's most expensive fossil, gets a new home
description: Stan, the world's most complete Tyrannosaurus rex skeleton, sold for $31.8 million in 2020 -- the highest price ever paid at auction for a fossil.

title: Ukrainian refugee shows CNN pictures of their destroyed home
description: CNN's Miguel Marquez spoke to Ukrainian refugees in a Romanian shelter about their decision to flee their country and the struggles they face.

title: Longtime Kremlin insider quits post and leaves Russia, state media says
description: Anatoly Chubais, a Russian government insider for decades, is leaving his job as President Vladimir Putin's special representative on the environment, Russian state news agency TASS reported Wednesday, citing an unnamed source.

title: Gifted and at the top of her game -- Ashleigh Barty shocks the sports world
description: On her day, Ashleigh Barty was an unstoppable force.

title: As bodies of Russian soldiers pile up in Ukraine, images of the dead make it difficult for Putin to claim they're not
description: Lviv, Ukraine (CNN) — The first warm, sunny days of spring in the southern Mykolaiv region are ushering in a grim new reality: the smell of the dead.

title: For Trump, the party's over
description: As the 2022 primary season gets underway, those of us who have long opposed former President Donald Trump may finally begin seeing an end to his reign over the Republican Party.

title: UK to cut taxes on wages and fuel as inflation soars
description: The UK government is cutting payroll taxes and duties on fuel in an attempt to take some of the sting out of the worst cost of living crisis in decades.

title: Putin just made the case for a European army
description: Four years ago, French President Emmanuel Macron, newly arrived in office, proposed a European Defense Force -- a counterweight to a NATO alliance he and increasingly other EU leaders feared was being effectively held hostage by the United States and especially Donald Trump.

title: 'No end is in sight.' Living with Covid means a life of lockdown for England's most vulnerable
European countries battling BA.2 variant lifted restrictions too 'brutally': WHO
description: Several European nations are facing a new spike in Covid-19 cases because they scrapped pandemic restrictions too soon, a senior World Health Organization (WHO) official has warned.

title: Instagram brings back option for reverse chronological feed
description: Instagram is bringing back a version of its news feed that sorts posts in reverse chronological order rather than ranked according to the platform's algorithms. However, the company said it will leave its algorithm ranking method on by default.

title: Olympic champion Evgeny Rylov pulls out of world championships in support of banned Russian athletes
description: Two-time Olympic gold medal swimmer Evgeny Rylov announced on Wednesday that he is withdrawing from this year's FINA World Championships in Budapest, Hungary in support of Russian athletes banned from competing under the Russian flag.

title: Signs of discontent appear in Middle East
description: The war in Ukraine has yet to enter its fourth week and its shockwaves are already being felt as far away as the Middle East, putting governments on edge as tensions simmer at home.

title: 5 mind-blowing places in Brazil you might not have heard of
description: Brazil is famed for its thundering Iguaçu Falls in the south, the crescent-shaped Copacabana neighborhood with its dazzling white sand beach in Rio de Janeiro and the towering Cristo Redentor -- Christ the Redeemer -- whose outstretched arms embrace that seaside city.

title: A receipt for 'invisible' art could fetch half a million dollars at auction
description: In 1958, artist Yves Klein famously opened an exhibition called "The Void," which saw him place a large cabinet in an otherwise empty room. Thousands of paying visitors turned up at a Paris gallery to catch a glimpse of nothing at all.

title: France and Manchester United star Paul Pogba reveals theft of World Cup medal
description: Paul Pogba's World Cup winner's medal was among the items stolen during a recent burglary at his home, the Manchester United midfielder has revealed.

title: Taliban postpones return to school for Afghan girls above 6th grade
description: The Taliban prevented girls above the 6th grade in Afghanistan from making their much-anticipated return to school on Wednesday.

title: Tokyo Fashion Week shines a light on homegrown talent
description: After successive seasons of canceled shows and virtual presentations, a largely in-person Tokyo Fashion Week returned in a blur of technicolor palettes, digital innovation and sculptural runway creations.

title: The human body is often seen through a male lens. 30 female photographers present a different view
description: Before film was invented, early portrait photographers first discovered the titillating pleasure of exposing images of nudes on silver copper plates. Since then, the male gaze has largely shaped how bodies are visualized in printed media.

title: What China really means when it talks about NATO's eastward expansion
description: When Russian armed forces launched an unprovoked assault on Ukraine last month, Beijing appeared to side with Moscow, accusing the United States and its NATO allies of inviting conflict by allowing their security bloc to expand eastward.

title: World No. 1 Ashleigh Barty announces she's retiring from professional tennis
description: World no. 1 Ashleigh Barty announced on Wednesday she was retiring from professional tennis after winning three major singles titles in the last three years.

title: Okta concedes hundreds of clients could be affected by breach
description: A January cybersecurity incident at popular identity authentication provider Okta may have affected hundreds of the firm's clients, Okta acknowledged late Tuesday amid an ongoing investigation of the breach.

title: Sri Lanka sends troops to fuel stations amid worsening economic crisis
description: Sri Lanka posted soldiers at hundreds of state-run gas stations on Tuesday to help distribute fuel after a sudden rise in prices of key commodities and accompanying shortages forced tens of thousands of people to queue for hours.

title: Air New Zealand launches 17-hour flight to New York City
description: For the first time in its history, Air New Zealand is offering direct flights between Auckland and New York City.

title: Small victories for Ukraine could herald a grim new phase for the war
description: On Monday, after intense fighting, Ukrainian forces regained control of Makariv, a town west of Kyiv that had been battered by Russian airstrikes.

title: Nevada authorities are searching for an 18-year-old woman whose disappearance they say is 'suspicious in nature'
description: Nevada authorities are asking for the public's help in finding an 18-year-old woman who has been missing for more than a week.

title: Tornadoes damaged an estimated 1,000 homes in Texas and now the storm is spawning more twisters in Mississippi and Louisiana
description: A storm system that on Monday brought 25 tornadoes to Texas, including two that may have damaged about 1,000 homes, was spawning more twisters Tuesday as it pushed east.

title: Anne Hathaway floors Kelly Clarkson in her own singing game
description: Anne Hathaway recognized Kelly Clarkson's own song, "Since U Been Gone," before Clarkson during a game on her talk show.

title: See Judge Jackson's emotional message to her daughters
description: Supreme Court nominee Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson shared an emotional moment at her confirmation hearing following Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) asking her to elaborate on her admission that she had not been 'as good of a mom' as she wanted.

title: New video shows intense firefight near Kyiv
description: An intense firefight between Ukrainian forces and the Russian military in the village of Velyka Dymerka, roughly 18 miles northeast of Kyiv, was caught on camera in new video circulating social media. CNN has geolocated and verified the authenticity of the video. CNN's Anderson Cooper has more.

title: Refrigerated trailers become makeshift morgues for over 700 Russian soldiers
description: CNN's Ivan Watson goes to a gravesite and makeshift morgue in Dnipro, Ukraine for those killed in the Russian invasion.
